page.title: 19RHYL VICAR'S TYPICAL DAY
page.content: At 7.30 a.m. the Verger rings the Vicar's doorbell to make sure he is up. 8 a.m. the Vicar and his Curates hold a service when they pray for a different need each day. 9-10 a.m. he works at his desk answering the telephone and writing letters. 10-12 noon he visits elderly people to cheer them up. 12-1 p.m. he has lunch often interrupted by telephone calls. 1-4 p.m. he visits the sick in hospitals or conducts funerals or weddings. 4-5 p.m. he answers more letters, prepares the next Sunday's sermon and reads. 5-6 p.m. is his meal time. From 6-7 p.m. he holds a Surgery in the Church Vestry for people to discuss their problems with him. Later he attends church meetings or functions arranged by the many organisations to which he is Chaplain. When he manages to have any free time he plays golf or gardens
